Tucson couldn't muster the courage to yell out his leader's name. It had co=
me out like the wisper of a wandering spirit.  Just as well. He now felt th=
at it wasn't the moment to make a definite move.  And to top things off, hi=
s foot was now begining to hurt him.  He would walk, stop for a moment and =
slowly begin walking again, but with a little bit of a limp.  He frowns at =
this, knowing that at that rate, it would take him a light year to reach Ro=
dimus.  Yet he also knew that if he transformed, someone would pick up on t=
he sound of his engine.

" Nope, I'm gonna grin and bear the pain.  Now, wh=
ich way?"  

Before he continues, he could feel tiny vibrations on the floo=
r by his feet.  Being blind he could now see with his sense of hearing, and=
 his sense of touch.  Someone was mobilizing, someone now knew he was there=
.

" I should have expected things wouldn't be easy for too long.. All righ=
t, time to put in some of Prowl's training to good use."  

He concentrates=
 for a moment, and then realizes that his sonar system could actually cloak=
 his own energy signatures and residual heat signatures as well.  It would =
mean they wouldn't be open for echo location but, it was a risk he needed t=
o take, and takes it quickly. He was now relying on his audio sensors and h=
is sense of touch to guide him further.  This also meant that he couldn't u=
se his system to locate Rodimus either.  He had to go on old information ju=
st gathered moments ago and hope that he was still in the same location whe=
re he had picked up on the signal.  A computer acts like an internal GPS wi=
thin his directory.  It blips when he comes to a corner of a wall, or a doo=
rway.

" When in doubt, give something up to save your aft."  

Yet, with a=
ll his precautions, he fails to notice that the wound on his foot was leaki=
ng lubricants.  He leaves a small trail of battery fluid behind with each t=
entative step.

> The blind Predacon moved away of the throne Room, it was tim=
e for his regular tasks and politics always bothered him, he was a scientis=

his lab and  attached himself, thanks to a USB devise to the computer and s=
tarted to check the segurity in the base... Somethign was terribly wrong a =
scramblign wave had been detected and that meant one thing: Troubles

> He turn off the alarm and sealed the base, that sunken down in the lava p=
ool while the segurity Drones were released.  Perceptor's lab (with Nightli=
ght inside), the dungeons, CR's and Intelligence rooms had been secured, in=
solated and sealed.

hen he heard his security chief warning said "Every one take a search PArty=
 and seek every inch of this base"

> ooc: You got it. Cyclonus better be ready, T=
ucson isn't one to give up too quickly. 
> 
> BIC:
> 
> The drive to succee=
d, it was now surging rapidly through Tucson's pistons and fuel injectors. =
He wasn't about to let a little pot hole get in the way of him reaching his=
 leader who he now believed was POW and held under demonic control. Reachin=
g speeds of well over one twenty MPH he kicks up dust beneath his tires and=
 handles the roughness of the terrain as if it were as smooth as newly laid=
 down asphault. His sonar systems now pick up the density and size of the d=
ark tower which drives him forward, not to mention the fact that he could p=
ick up heat signatures which resembled his own. He knew. Rodimus was there,=
 and no doubt he'd be there with some familliar enemies. The thought of Dec=
epticons being involved in this enrages him even more.
> 
> He thinks thing=
s through while driving toward the tower, where he could sense Rodimus's he=
at signatures.
> 
> " How could I have let this happen? If I hadn't let my =
guard down the first time, and gotten myself shot, you wouldn't be in this =
mess Rodimus. I promise you this though, this time, I will bring you back, =
and I will not abandon you. No matter how hateful you are of me, no matter =
how badly you want to destroy me. My spark is dedicated to those I care dee=
ply for. That part of me will never die. I will also make those who are res=
ponsible for what they have done to you, pay for what they did. They had no=
 right taking your spark and your soul. I swear by the name of Primus that =
I will risk my own spark to see yours safely out of harm's way."
> 
> He wa=
s now nearing the tower. Another familliar signature pings loudly in his so=
nar system. He could tell by the frequency that it was from a Decepticon. H=
e could also identify the carrier.
> 
> "Cyclonus... Ohh yeah, this definit=
ely has your name writen all over it. Right, well, enjoy the party while it=
 lasts because I'm about to crash it... Literally."
> 
> He senses he's onl=
y a few feet from the tower, and transforms. Yet, he keeps hidden. He knew =
that an all out attack wasn't the best way to go. If he was going to succee=
d in this mission, he'd have to do it without being seen and right undernea=
th Cyclonus's nose. He was good at staying out of the sight of the enemy. N=
ot only had he trained with Kup, but also trained with Prowl. Silence was h=
is middle name. He sends a low powered sonar wave to see if it picks up any=
thing. In the general area he was clear of incombants. He knew that if he t=
ouched the tower there could be an alarm system. He scans for that.
> 
> "H=
mm... Just in case, I should activate a scrambling wave. That should quiet =
any security system that could be active here.. I hope."
> 
> He waits a go=
od five minuts or so until he's sure that the system is disabled. Once he r=
uns a scan of his sonar systems, he concludes that it did indeed have a mil=
d effect on the system, which made it safe for him to approach the tower. H=
e again hides behind a mass of debris, and finds that breeze catches his fa=
ce, from the opposite side of the tower. There was a door that was partiall=
y opened. He feels for it with his fingers, and quietly slides it open just=
 enough to sqeeze in, which was a little bit of a squeeze for him. This was=
 it, he was inside. Again, not wanting to make it obvious, he quietly slide=
s the door just a bit ajar, to make sure he isn't discovered. Then, quietly=
 he hides again, and stops to try to pick up Rodimus's heat signature once =
more. It was difficult, because his temperature continued to drop with ever=
y ounce of energy that was being stolen from him. 
> 
> " All right, low he=
at signature, this is going to make it a little difficult to track. Time to=
 boost up my receptors a bit... And it wouldn't hurt to scramble my signals=
 either..." 
> 
> Tucson had never known fear and apprehension. With every =
slow step, he becomes more and more familliar with both emotions. He couldn=
't let them stop him. He was doing this to save Rodimus, a gesture from the=
 spark who's power is relentless. His affections for his leader keeps him f=
ocused on the task at hand. And it isn't long until his persistance pays of=
f. The ping was loud and clear, and yes, it was Rodimus. The signature read=
 Decepticon though. But knowing what Kenzo had told him, he keeps reserved.=
 Now, he wanted to be seen and heard. With his cross bow subspaced he stand=
s idol, but ready for anything. And quietly with a soft tone of voice..
> 
=
> "Rodimus."
>

ogether and now realized that his restoration abilities along with his skil=
ls as a warrior, would be needed more than ever. To him Restoration was mor=
e than just restoring artifacts, making them appear and work like new, it w=
as also about restoring old programming and recovery of important data. He =
did not know the extent of the corruption upon which was placed on Rodimus =
but he knew he couldn't just throw in the towel on his leader. Autobots stu=
ck together, and through thick and thin, he'd keep his pledge to never aban=
don his fellow Autobots. He also realized that if he was going to get anywh=
ere, he'd have to do it himself. 
> > >>>

ink I'll go this one alone. Don't wait up for me, I don't think I'll be bac=
k too soon."

oom.

r Rodimus. He'll need it more than me."

> > >>> He was dead set o=
n recovering his leader. And this time, nothing and no one would get in his=
 way of achieving his mission. He sends one final message to Lord Perseus.
=
> > >>> 
> > >>> "Lord Perseus, it's come to my attention that my leader, R=
odimus Prime, has been abducted and altered severely. This puts the Matrix =
of Leadership at a grave Risk, but most of all, his spark, which I believe =
is too precious to waste for evil purposes. I can not abandon my leader, no=
t even in his corruptive state. I hereby announce that I am on route to loc=
ating my leader, and I DO intend to BRING HIM BACK. Hopefully, the damage c=
an be reversed. If not, there is question of the well being of the Matrix. =
I must recover it, perhaps not for my own personal gain, but for the benefi=
t of Autobot kind. It's too precious to lose to the hands of those who thir=
st for power and greed. I swear by Primus's name, I will return, but my ret=
urn may not be a fast one. May Primus guide you as he guides me. This is Tu=
cson, signing off. I will report to you again, once I know more of the cond=
ition of my leader."
> > >>>

transforms into SUV mode, hoping to find Rodimus via his sonar systems.
